channel.title: The truth about peta
channel.description: my friend sent me this, i studied it on several websites and even contacted 1 research lab. I used to even support peta cause i cant stand the thought of death let alone homicide. However THIS my friends is beyond republican's and the hypocrites they have. I disagree with both democratic and republican parties and i really dont care about politikz but i really thing this is just mind blowing. Be warned there is a few "pics" idk if they would be allowed or not due to the kinds of people visiting these forums. [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rm4zkGQiOMw&NR=1][img]http://graphjam.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/funny-graphs-peta-u-scary.gif[/img][/url] discuss....

item.title: The truth about peta
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

from what im reading this thread is about how peta is bad? ill i see is bad is the fact they spend money on things that dont pertain to what they do like rejected superbowl ads, donating to convicts. if you say killing the animals are bad well yes if they could actually find ppl to adopt the animals i would be against killing them. but if no one is going to adopt them theres no reason to keep them, its just a waste of money, dog and cat food cost money. employees, management, company vehicles, gas for those vehicles, and all the other expenses need to keep a business running takes money.

$33 million i hope would be more than enough to cover those expenses though. im not a animal hater or anything i have 2 dogs, a bird, and a crap load of cats. i love my dogs dont care too much about the bird and cats.

the fact is u have to control population of every species, humans mess up mother nature and natural selection all the time with pets. u have to look at the big picture. im a pretty caring person but when u have no way of doing the best possible solution u have to use the nest best possible one. the best possible solution is to let everyone and everything live until natural death, problem with that the world isnt in perfect harmony where stuff like that can happen, 2 u would have to have practically an unlimited supply of resources, and caretakers; its just not going to happen in this day and age. the next best is to save as many animals from abuse and abandonment as possible, and choose everyone that has a chance for a new owner, and put the rest to sleep(much better then being forced to fight, tortured, starved, or any other horrible treatment that leads to death b/c the way they put them to sleep isnt painful at all(except i guess the needle)).

Read full topic

item.title: The truth about peta
item.dc:creator: @mcbeans mcbeans
item.description:
@mcbeans wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:4, topic:408764”]My uncle used to be in PETA for virginia. He got kicked out of it for sexual harassment or something like that to the members. My uncle’s pretty crazy but he’s smart as hell. He was harassing everybody on their facebook wall haha.

OT:
I think PETA should give away the animals instead of putting them down.[/quote]
agreed. Animals deserve a chance to live (unless the world is starving), i mean i fuckin love meat but i wont eat cats and dogs… i mean srrusly.
instead they’re just a bunch of stupid fucks. (again, not speaking of the volunteers)[quote=“ziplock, post:5, topic:408764”][quote author=mcbeans link=topic=510043.msg3700947#msg3700947 date=1312747504]

How do you protest P.Diddy?

no fucking clue, dont buy his music i guess? if that’s the case then i’ve been protesting him since birth O_O
[/quote]

Apparently I’ve been protesting P. Diddy since I was in the whom.[/quote]
captain obvious just made a joke O_O

Read full topic
